templates/about.mustache.app_about:
Spaces introduces SMU Libraries' two physical libraries through photos and quick facts.

SMU Libraries is the heartbeat of Singapore Management University, a centre where researchers and learners converge to share and acquire academic and professional knowledge.

Together, Li Ka Shing Library and Kwa Geok Choo Law Library offer more than 11,000m2 of learning spaces to the SMU community.

slides.title: Li Ka Shing Library
slides.caption: The Li Ka Shing Library was officially opened in 2006. The building has unique architectural features that let in abundant natural light. Greenery cascades down the library's modern, curvilinear facade.
SMU Libraries has more than 380,000 printed and electronic books, 80,000 print and electronic journals, 160 eletronic databases and 17,000 SMU research publications.
Li Ka Shing library has a seating capacity of 1,800.

slides.title: Investment Studio
slides.caption: The Investment Studio is a dedicated space for accessing high-end financial databases, including Bloomberg, Eikon, Capital IQ.
Users can hone their technical skills in business research in a professional environment.

slides.title: Hive
slides.caption: The Hive is specially designed to support active group learning. It is usually open for student use but it can be reserved for lessons and events.
It has flexible seating and five inter-connected projection screens. The space can accommodate 50 seats.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: The Learning Commons is a 24-hour study space that caters to both group and individual learning.
For those seeking inspiration, floor-to-ceiling windows look out to the Campus Green.
A mix of booth tables, group seating and individual carrels cater to different learning styles.

slides.title: Learning Labs
slides.caption: Learning Labs 1 and 2 in the Li Ka Shing Library are equipped with video-conferencing technology and flexible furniture.
The Learning Labs are usually open for student use but they can be reserved for meetings, lessons or events. The tables can be configured for different group sizes.

slides.title: Lounge
slides.caption: The Lounge offers popular books, DVDs, magazines and newspapers (and sometimes Smoo Smoo) in a comfortable setting.

slides.title: DVD Collection
slides.caption: Cheaper and better than Netflix Singapore.

slides.title: Lifestyle Collection
slides.caption: The Lifestyle Collection includes award-winning titles, travel guides, popular non-fiction and Singapore literature.
Relax in the Lounge with a newspaper and a cuppa (with a lid).

slides.title: Project Rooms
slides.caption: There are project rooms on all floors of Li Ka Shing Library for group discussions and project work.
The project room under the stairs.
Discussion with Smoo Smoo.

slides.title: L2 Quiet Area
slides.caption: Quiet Areas are for work that requires intense concentration. There is a mix of tables and carrels in the L2 Quiet Area.

slides.title: L4 Quiet Area
slides.caption: The L4 Quiet Area is a Hog-Free zone.

slides.title: L5 Quiet Area
slides.caption: The L5 Quiet Area is sometimes used for events and seminars.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge
slides.caption: The Graduate Lounge and Suite are study areas exclusive to graduate students.

slides.title: Rooftop Garden
slides.caption: The rooftop garden offers space for relaxation and contemplation. Please do not smoke here.
View of the Singapore Art Museum dome and Rochor area in the distance.
View of the National Museum of Singapore. In the background, Orchard Road.

slides.title: Study Booths
slides.caption: Study Booths with LCD screens are located on Levels 3 and 4.

slides.title: Study Booths
slides.caption: Booths can be booked online for project discussion and presentation rehearsals.
Booths can comfortably seat 6. (Uncomfortably, 10.)

slides.title: Kwa Geok Choo Law Library
slides.caption: The Kwa Geok Choo Law Library is SMU's second library. It was officially opened by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on 15 March 2017.
The law collection is located on L4 and consists of textbooks, law reports and international legal journals. Kwa Geok Choo Law Library hosts a print collection of 21,000 volumes.

slides.title: Atrium
slides.caption: The Atrium offers casual study spaces for users to enjoy.
Faculty publications are on display. These books are not for loan or browsing.
The early bird catches the worm.
The Kwa Geok Choo Law Library has seating space for approximately 500 users.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: A 24/7 study space offered by the library for those wanting to keep working after library opening hours.
The Learning Commons can seat about 100.
There are two entrances to the Learning Commons: one is outside of the library and one is within the School of Law.

slides.title: Learning Labs 3 & 4
slides.caption: Learning Labs 3 & 4 are often used to hold library events including seminars and workshops.
When not in used for training, users are welcome to use it for their own personal study.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge
slides.caption: Kwa Geok Choo Law Library provides a Graduate Lounge exclusively for graduate students.
There is a dedicated meeting room for graduates to use for group discussions.
Mid-assignment brooding.

slides.title: Project Rooms
slides.caption: 13 project rooms can be booked by undergraduate and graduate students for group study and discussion. The orange couches have built-in power outlets.
The rooms are equipped with screens that support wireless projection from multiple devices simultaneously.

slides.title: L4 Quiet Area
slides.caption: There is a spacious quiet area on L4 where students can study while enjoying the view of Fort Canning Park.
These "Business Class Seats" offer users a cosy space to curl up in.
There are individual study carrels here.
We have all kinds of tables for all kinds of people.

slides.title: Terrace
slides.caption: The terrace is accessible from 8.00 am to 7.30 pm for those who need a little bit of fresh air.
You can admire the view of Fort Canning Park here.
